post_text:
Ipad Pick up at Englewood Hills

I am just sending out another reminder to all of our families at Englewood Hills.

There is a $30.00 insurance fee for the iPad in addition to the school fees. Please go to https://www.northmontschools.com/7/News/997 to pay school fees. If you have not registered for Payschools, please select ‚ÄúRegister‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúLog-in‚Äù and follow the instructions.

Materials needed for 1st Quarter will be available for pick up at the following times. Any student 2nd - 6th grade can come at either of the time periods.

Tuesday, August 25th 10:30 am-12:30 pm
Wednesday, August 26th 7 am- 10 am

Put your CHILDS NAME and GRADE LEVEL in the front window of your car.
You‚Ä¶

post_text:
Good Afternoon EH families! I hope you are all staying healthy and have had a nice summer. As you are aware, with the recent rise in COVID-19 cases we will all be doing remote learning this fall. This was not an easy decision to make, as we all want everyone to be in school and structure to be in place.
Since this was such a recent decision, we still are fine tuning several things. I will keep you up to date as soon as information comes to me.

What we are doing now:
- Verifying class lists (Please make sure you have completed InfoSnap for the 2020-2021 school year)
Click on this link to complete: https://registration.powerschool.com/family/gosnap.aspx?action=23007&culture=en
- Creating‚Ä¶

REGISTRATION.POWERSCHOOL.COM
A Snapcode is Required to Continue

post_text:
Safety Patrol at Englewood Hills!!!

Are you responsible and trustworthy?
Are you looking for a way to help your fellow students be safe on their way to and from school?
Are you going into 5th or 6th grade?

If so, Englewood Hills Safety Patrol is for YOU!

If you are interested in joining the Safety Patrol at Englewood Hills for the 2020-2021 school year, please read this carefully and send Mr. Shafer an email (details on email below) by Friday July 31st.
jshafer@northmontschools.net

Sending an email of interest does not guarantee a spot on patrol for next year, several factors will be considered (attendance, availability, classroom behavior, grades, etc.). Spots will be limited this‚Ä¶

post_text:
I hope everyone is having a great start to their summer! Don't forget to READ!!!!! Students who don't read over the summer regress significantly and it can take months to catch back up int he fall. I can't stress this enough and wanted to share with you the great programs our library has to encourage summer reading. Check it out for all the great prizes and fun!
http://www.daytonmetrolibrary.org/summer

shared_text:
Thunder-Bots Robotics FLL Team #15866
May 15 at 11:33 AM ¬∑

We are recruiting new team members! After 5 years together, our previous team is aging out of FLL and we are forming a new Thunder-Bots Robotics FLL Challenge team. We are looking for kids who are enrolled in any of the elementary schools within the Northmont City School District and who will be entering 4th grade in the fall (potential to consider kids entering 5th grade). We are looking for kids who have been identified as gifted, as we believe these kids can especially benefit from enrichment opportunities and what our team has to offer. If interested please see flyer below and email: jenniferlfranks@yahoo.com

*Please note - Given the current pandemic and uncertainty, right now we are simply gathering names of kids/families who may be interested. Applications and potential try it nights will come later this summer.

post_text:
Good afternoon Englewood Hills Families!
As you know, Governor DeWine has extended the closure of Ohio schools through the end of the school year. With that order, we realize we need to begin finalizing grades, collecting iPads and planning for transitions to the next grade or middle school building. Instruction will look different as we begin the transition. The Week of May 4th, students will participate in online enrichment activities as well as continuing to utilize apps such as RAZkids, ScootPad, Dreambox, and other apps teachers have shared. The Week of May 11th, students will continue using those same apps for online learning opportunities.

On May 13th-15th, we will be collecting all‚Ä¶

post_text: Brandie Hoskins was an inspiration to all of our students today! She spoke to the them about setting goals and doing everything within your power to reach them, regardless of the setbacks you have. She is a graduate of Dunbar High School as well as The Ohio State University (Biology) and retired player of WNBA Seattle Storm. We were all impressed with her humble and genuinely kind spirit. ‚ù§Ô∏èüôåüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

post_text:
Hello Parents!
It's October and we have noticed that students have already broken or misplaced their headphones. It is important that they have them when working on the iPads. If you would like to purchase headphones or earbuds, they are available in the office for $2 each. We admit that they are not the highest quality, but they work and are affordable. Please ask your child if they have their headphones/earbuds so that you are aware that they need replaced. Thank you!!

post_text: The staff at Englewood Hills is looking for guest speakers from our Dayton community to present on any of the pillars of character and how it connects to the real world. The pillars include Caring, Respect, Trustworthy, Citizenship, Fair & Responsible. If you know someone who would be interested in speaking to our students for 30 minutes or so, please contact Mrs. Grothaus, EH Principal at 832-5950 or kgrothaus@northmontschools.net.
text: The staff at Englewood Hills is looking for guest speakers from our Dayton community to present on any of the pillars of character and how it connects to the real world. The pillars include Caring, Respect, Trustworthy, Citizenship, Fair & Responsible. If you know someone who would be interested in speaking to our students for 30 minutes or so, please contact Mrs. Grothaus, EH Principal at 832-5950 or kgrothaus@northmontschools.net.

post_text:
We hope everyone is having a great summer!!!
I am pleased to announce that Englewood Hills is partnering with Miami Valley Leadership Foundation to provide mentors for select students in our building.

Why are we doing this? Research has shown us the largest impact on a students future is the relationships they have with those surrounding them. We want to continue to provide positive role models to support our young students.

These mentors will be spending one hour a week with their student, every week of the school year.

Would you be interested in being a mentor?
-Check with your employer, some work places now provide volunteer hours to give back to their community.
-A 2.5 Hour Training is required
-Security checks must be passed

The more mentors we have, the more we can support our youth!

A training session will be taking place TONIGHT at First Baptist Church on Shaw Rd. in Union from 4-6:30 PM. As more interest is created, additional trainings will be offered.

shared_text:
Northmont City Schools
July 13, 2019 at 8:17 AM ¬∑

YMCA Before and After Care Program

Northmont has partnered with YMCA to expand the high quality before and after school program to all five elementary schools for the 2019-2020 school year, that has been running very successfully at the Kleptz Early Learning Center. Open houses will be held at each elementary during the week of July 23-25. Check our website for updates throughout this summer, and see current information listed below:

ENROLLMENT PACKETS for the 2019-2020 School Year are now available at the Front Desk of the Kleptz YMCA, and at the Northmont District office at 4001 Old Salem Rd.

The packet MUST be completed in full and returned before your child is considered‚Ä¶

post_text: At last night's Board of Education meeting, Dina Wayne was presented with the Superintendent's Helping Hands award. She's the first person in district history to receive this award from 2 different school buildings! Thank you Dina for everything you do for our kids!

EH School Supply Lists

post_text: New parents to Englewood Hills, Please feel free to contact Mrs. Carter by phone or email to request your Progress Book Login beginning Mon. Aug. 6th. You will need this to find out who your child's homeroom teacher is beginning Aug. 9th, as well as to check grades throughout the school year. Your login will be emailed to you to insure accuracy. You can email Mrs. Carter at vcarter@northmontschools.net or phone her at 832-5950.
